thread.title_full: Gabriel Jesus to have surgery in Barcelona with Pep Guardiola hopeful of return within two months

author: James Ducker
title: Gabriel Jesus to have surgery in Barcelona with Pep Guardiola hopeful of return within two months
text:
G abriel Jesus is expected to have surgery on his broken metatarsal in Barcelona on Friday with Pep Guardiola hopeful that the Manchester City striker could return in two months.
The Brazilian was due to fly to the Spanish city on Thursday in order to be assessed by Dr Ramon Cugat, the orthopaedic surgeon favoured by Guardiola, ahead of an anticipated operation at the Quironsalud hospital.
Jesus suffered the fracture in his right foot during the first half of City’s 2-0 win away to Bournemouth on Monday and since has had his foot in a protective boot and been using crutches.
But while there were concerns the 19-year-old could be out for as long as three months, there is some optimism that the player could be available in just over eight weeks if surgery and his rehabilitation go to plan.
Jesus has hit the ground running at City Credit: Reuters C ity spent millions establishing a first class medical facility at their CFA training complex but Guardiola has often encouraged players to travel to Barcelona to be seen by Dr Cugat, with whom he has a long-standing relationship, since taking charge at the Etihad Stadium last summer.
City captain Vincent Kompany has made several visits to see him this season and midfielder Kevin De Bruyne has done the same. Another midfielder, Ilkay Gundogan, was also treated at Dr Cugat’s clinic in December after suffering cruciate ligament damage that ruled him out for the season.
Kompany has paid several trips to the doctor Guardiola recommends in Barcelona Credit: Rex Features G uardiola is expected to provide an update on Jesus’s situation at his press briefing on Friday ahead of City’s FA Cup fifth round tie away to Huddersfield Town on Saturday but the Brazilian’s absence will leave the manager counting on Sergio Aguero.
Aguero had lost his place to Jesus with both the player and Guardiola admitting they were uncertain what the future holds for the Argentina striker but he will become a key figure again for the manager over the coming months after the injury to Jesus.
Watch | Pep on Philipp Lahm: Exceptional person exceptional player 01:27 G uardiola will take his squad to Abu Dhabi next Wednesday, the day after the first leg of their Champions League round of 16 tie at home to Monaco, for a short warm weather training break and bonding exercise. City do not play again until they travel to the Stadium of Light to face Sunderland in the Premier League on Sunday March 4 after their league game at home to Manchester United was postponed because of their rival's involvement in the League Cup final.
So Guardiola has taken the decision to escape to the emirate, when he will also take the opportunity to meet with City chairman Khaldoon al-Mubarak and the club's Abu Dhabi hierarchy.
Who is your Premier League clubs unlucky charm?
